description.narrative: Output 2016-2017: D'ici Ã fin 2017, au moins 75.000 nouvelles personnes dans des communautÃ©s, les Ã©coles, et les centres de santÃ© ont un accÃ¨s Ã l'eau potable et consomment une eau de bonne qualitÃ©.Output 2014-2015: By the end of 2015, the authorities at communal level in Central Plateau, Centre Nord, Est, Boucle du Mouhoun and Hauts Bassins perform regular monitoring of the implementation of the WASH component of communal development plans and at least 30% of households in these regions consume good quality waterOutput 2011-2013: By the end of 2015, 73 per cent of the population in Plateau Central and 66 per cent of the population in Centre Nord have equitable and permanent access to and manage safe drinking water points.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 2016-2017: D’ici à fin 2017, au moins 75.000 nouvelles personnes dans des communautés, les écoles, et les centres de santé ont un accès à l’eau potable et consomment une eau de bonne qualité.Output 2014-2015: By the end of 2015, the authorities at communal level in Central Plateau, Centre Nord, Est, Boucle du Mouhoun and Hauts Bassins perform regular monitoring of the implementation of the WASH component of communal development plans and at least 30% of households in these regions consume good quality waterOutput 2011-2013: By the end of 2015, 73 per cent of the population in Plateau Central and 66 per cent of the population in Centre Nord have equitable and permanent access to and manage safe drinking water points.

description.narrative: UNICEF continued to support the improved access to drinking water of 40,700 persons including 21,200 women and girls in schools and communities in the East, North and Sahel Regions, and launched initiatives to improve borehole drilling and management of water points through public-private partnerships in rural areas. | Status:Met | As-of Date:30/03/2018

title.narrative: Schools with access to improved drinking water in the reporting year only, with UNICEF direct support
